p: H6 AIVs have been one of the predominant subtypes circulating since the 1970s in live bird markets (LBMs) in southern China and later South Korea, Vietnam, Cambodia, Thailand and Laos, and caused significant morbidity in domestic poultry. Domestic poultry can be defined as including chickens, turkeys, geese and ducks, that are raised for the production of meat or eggs. H6 continues to circulate in LBMs and is prevalent in several countries ( Figure 5).
